alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 4:31AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TO BRING TRANSITIONS BETWEEN SNOW, RAIN, AND FREEZING RAIN ON SUNDAY... A frontal system will begin to push inland across Southwest Alaska on Sunday morning. Conditions will initially be cold enough for snow as precipitation first arrives, but much warmer air aloft will lead to a quick transition to rain for the Kuskokwim Delta and coastal areas of Bristol Bay. A brief period of light freezing rain is possible Sunday morning into the early afternoon during the transition from snow to rain. Any ice accumulations are most likely to be trace to a few hundredths of an inch. Precipitation will spread across interior Bristol Bay later on Sunday and will most likely remain snow, although a brief period of mixed precipitation is possible. By Sunday night, much colder air behind the front is expected to turn any remaining precipitation to snow.
